Class FischerClock

java.lang.Object
com.reversi.common.FischerClock
public class FischerClock extends Object
A clock implementation based on the Fischer time control mechanism.

Each side (white and black) is given an initial time, and every move results in a bonus time added to the clock of the player who just moved.

This class supports serialization and deserialization using custom Jackson serializers. Note that transient fields (ticker, lock, running, eventBus) are not serialized.

Usage: In production a real ticker (e.g., Ticker) should be provided; for testing purposes, a dummy ticker (e.g., FischerClock.NoOpTicker) can be used.

  • Constructor Details

    • FischerClock

      public FischerClock(long initialTimeMillis, long bonusMillis, boolean whiteStarts)
      Constructs a new FischerClock with the specified initial time, bonus time, and starting side.

      In production, a real ticker should be supplied via setTicker(ITicker). During testing, it may be replaced with a dummy implementation.

      Parameters:
      initialTimeMillis - the initial time (in milliseconds) for both players
      bonusMillis - the bonus time (in milliseconds) added on each move
      whiteStarts - true if the white player starts; false if black starts

  • Method Details

    • setTicker

      public void setTicker(ITicker ticker)
      Sets the ticker responsible for generating time ticks.
      Parameters:
      ticker - the ticker implementation to be used

    • setEventBus

      public void setEventBus(EventBus eventBus)
      Sets the event bus which will receive clock events such as timeouts.
      Parameters:
      eventBus - the event bus implementation for dispatching events

    • start

      public void start()
      Starts the clock. This method initiates the ticker to generate tick events at regular intervals.

      If the clock is already running, calling this method has no effect.

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Stops the clock. This stops the ticker and marks the clock as no longer running.

    • swap

      public void swap()
      Swaps the active player after a move has been made.

      When this method is called, a bonus is added to the clock of the player who just moved, and the turn is toggled to the other player.

    • getWhiteTimeMillis

      public long getWhiteTimeMillis()
      Returns the current remaining time for the white player.
      Returns:
      white player's remaining time in milliseconds

    • setWhiteTimeMillis

      public void setWhiteTimeMillis(long t)
      Sets the remaining time for the white player.
      Parameters:
      t - the new time in milliseconds for the white player

    • getBlackTimeMillis

      public long getBlackTimeMillis()
      Returns the current remaining time for the black player.
      Returns:
      black player's remaining time in milliseconds

    • setBlackTimeMillis

      public void setBlackTimeMillis(long t)
      Sets the remaining time for the black player.
      Parameters:
      t - the new time in milliseconds for the black player

    • formatTime

      public String formatTime(long millis)
      Formats a time value in milliseconds into a string in "MM:SS" format.
      Parameters:
      millis - the time value in milliseconds
      Returns:
      a formatted string representing minutes and seconds
